title: Just won my promos to Gold V

replies.body:
Good job. I remember how special it felt when I got to gold.
Hope you continue to have a swimmingly climb. {{champion:105}}

Youd better be at least gold 5 with all the help low elo players get from riot after crying for years about not getting the oh so amazing season rewards. ( apart from their miserable silver border of course)

has it ever occurred to u that u have to win against other human beings to climb, and therefore elo is relative? In order for someone to be gold, there also has to be bronze and silver. Therefore ur statement is invalid.

Even with stuff like promo helper that rito gave everyone, there's still g2 be bronze and silver players for gold players to exist.
For real, are these guys slow or something? Wtf are they talking about?
thats actually kind of true. Everybody should be able to get to gold. You get a free win in your series... It's basically GIVEN to you.  nonetheless congrats to the guy

> [{quoted}](name=Corsair Sion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hEPPxa2c,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2017-05-24T04:21:57.387+0000)
>
> thats actually kind of true. Everybody should be able to get to gold. You get a free win in your series... It's basically GIVEN to you.  nonetheless congrats to the guy

The logic is weak in this one.
_anyone_ should be able to get to gold, but not _everyone_ can; someone has to lose LP for someone else to gain LP

Yup, basic economics really. LP is like a closed system economy where there is an extremely limited influx of LP (new players and the tiny net gains made by a winning team) and that means your LP "wealth" is relative to everyone else's lack or excess of LP

> [{quoted}](name=Ant Eater king,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hEPPxa2c,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-05-24T02:56:55.050+0000)
>
> It is good day!
> {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Congrats bro, good feeling.

I just advanced to Silver 1, heading your way soon!
Good luck, but not that you would need it {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

And it's an accomplishment for them.
I'm sure you'll feel the same way when you get out of bronze flex.
Heh. You're not a very happy person person are you

I just found it interesting that you spent the time to try to belittle someone's achievement, be it large or small. Most people would not do such a thing unless are they emotionally distressed (or if the other person is trying to earn some undue fame, reward, etc.). 

You probably should not have belittled someone's statement of satisfaction in themselves, but I should not have implied unhappiness was amusing. My apologies, it was uncouth of me.

Maybe he should have posted in Miscellaneous, reaching a new rank is a gameplay related topic too though.

I don't think he was trying to brag though. Obviously I don't know his heart, but it seems like he just wanted to celebrate his success with people who appreciate its meaning. You get a new job, you probably tell your friends because they are invested in your life and thus find joy when you do. Similarly, League players understand that climbing in ranked can be tough and thus it's not hard to sympathize with another who made the ranked climb and revel in their victory. It doesn't seem like he was trying to put himself above others.

You are certainly entitled to thinking it's stupid just as the OP is allowed post about his success. No one is forced to upvote.

> No it's not. His post has 0 value and there is no gameplay related issue.

No one said posts on Gameplay had to have any value or issues. it's not the Report A Bug board. Gold V is construct of the game League of Legends, he played the game and posted about it.

> Obviously he is brag about it because no other player created that topic. If he wants to seek attention then better choice would be telling his own mom.

I save seen several topics about the exact same thing, but I'm not sure why that matters. I doubt his mom would appreciate his accomplishment as much as the random people on these boards since these people can fully comprehend the difficulties of League's ranked system. Is it so wrong to let random people know about your accomplishments?

> Never said he did. You don't have to put yourself above the others to brag about something.

True. I guess when I think of brag I usually think of something like "I did/have something that you don't." However, if he is acknowledging himself at no one else's expense, what is the problem?

> When millions of people got a new job maybe even better or despite many obstacles they don't create a new topic. Because it's not something to have to tell other unknown people.

So are you saying that people should not seek recognition from anyone but those they know personally? If you won a lot of money, would you not proclaim your excitement to those around you? Should the sports teams not televise awards ceremonies because no one knows them? I don't think you need to know people personally to share your success with them.

> No one is forced to upvote, great argument. No one is forced to read my comments, reply to them. No one is forced to create this topic and brag about reaching gold V to unknown people.

So we are in agreement then? The OP had every right to post this topic, and you don't have to like it, and I don't have to not like it? Or are you likening your comments to this topic which you mentioned is stupid, and thus my discussion with you is pointless?

We may just have differing opinions then. Personally, I think humans are a pretty social people and thus they can talk with other unknown people about almost anything (maybe not so much thing of a personal matter). Even though they do not know each other, strangers can also sympathize with another's emotions. We can feel sad for the victims of a crime or happy for the guy who beat cancer even though we have never met them before.

I think the purpose of the League boards was to allow people who play League to communicate with unknown people who also play league. I certainly can see why you could see this post as cluttering the boards. I don't personally see it that way because I am happy that he is happy, and I imagine  the same to be true vice versa. Emotional health is important even in professional environments.

You might think of it as boasting, but considering that fact that it was at no one else's expense I see it has sharing his feeling of happiness. He is certainly not a special snowflake in this regard. True not a whole lot of people post of their success and I believe that is because A. there are not that many people on the boards compared to the actual game and B. (as you mentioned) the people of the boards usually upvote things of more gameplay related value. But there are literally hundreds of popular snowflakes on YouTube who boast of their success in the game, and thousands more who do it for no other reason than to share their moments with total strangers.

I'll end by saying that I think he was justified in posting on the Gameplay board. It encompasses almost all of the actions and constructs in the game League of Legends, including reaching Gold V. No value or issue necessary. If you really disagree, I'd suggest you report the topic so the moderators can take it down.

Well it looks like we are not going to be seeing eye to eye on this one. I've said my peace, you've disagreed. At this point we are arguing in circles. You may think he has gone against social mores, but he has a **net** of 50+ votes so either quite a few people disagree with your ideals and/or quite a few people do not think it is not worth downvoting. That does not mean you are wrong, but it is more telling of how the majority thinks. Something to consider when you argue for what is or is not socially acceptable.

Ill just address a few things before I go:
> No information about gameplay is necessary in gameplay section. TOP KEK

Perhaps you did not read what I wrote. I said "value or issue" not "gameplay information." They can be very different things.

> Mods may not care enough.

That is what we call an excuse. I doubt you have reported many thing to the mods before (since most people have not) or know them personally so I doubt you know how much they do or do not care about their job. Besides that, it will take 5 seconds and 2 clicks so you have nothing to lose.

> Even if they didn't take it down it doesn't mean I am wrong.

I Never said otherwise.

> What social mores?

The social mores pertaining to how people share their achievements with each other.

> I don't argue about what is or isn't socially acceptable.

Maybe I misunderstood your point then, but it seems to be you have been arguing that is bad/dumb/not socially acceptable to share one's achievements with other unknown people (bragging as you call it) and that the OP should have just told his mom instead. 

> But it's the same exact thing. This is gameplay boards so value or issues means value of gameplay information or issues about gameplay. No information means no value or no issues.

It's really not. He said he was gold V. Did that have value? No. Was it and issue? No. Was it informative? Yes, I did not know he was gold V until he told me. Similarly people will post complaints with out issue or value such as "Yasuo is dumb." Currently this is acceptable in the gameplay board. Perhaps posts should require some value. I would be ok with that. However, I don't think there need to be issues. For example, a post discussing why Kindred's new kit is a heathy change for the game presents no issue but could still be of value to people when they consider game balance.

> This is not an excuse. Mods may not take a proper care about this issue.

So why did you bring it up if not to make an excuse to not submit a report? Was it to imply that the mods may not take action on your report and thus I might look down on you if they didn't. Like I said, I could care less if they do or don't. I would just like for you to take action to correct what you believe to be wrong. It would be of a lot more value than arguing or complaining to random people on post about a success.
You enjoying silver my dude?
Someone sounds really salty. It's not my fault you can't climb, I was just excited and wanted to share my excitement with the community. If you can't handle that then fuck off. Have a nice day! <3

While your whole comment is retarded and reeks of saltiness, there's one thing I wanna home in on. 

"This is not gameplay related.
I don't care if you were exited or not.
You among MILLIONS of people had to create a topic. Boo hoo, great achievement, reached Gold V. Don't forget to include it in your CV."

First of all, yes this is gameplay related, ranking up and gaining elo is a part of the game. It involves playing the game, therefore it's gameplay related.

Second of all, I wasn't complaining about how hard it was to make a thread, I just said I wanted to express my joy, and I did. And again you really seem to hate the fact that I'm happy about reaching gold 5, that REEKS of insecurity.

But I mainly wanted to react to "I don't care if you were exited or not". Like... you honestly had to gall to tell me that I'M the special snowflake when you post shit like this? "I DON'T CARE THAT YOU GOT GOLD 5, THEREFORE NO ONE CARES, THIS POST IS STUPID AND SHOULDN'T EXIST CUZ THE WORLD REVOLVES AROUND ME! REEEEEEEE". 54 other people cared about it, enough to sign it, like it, and a few even commented congratulating me and sending some jokes and jabs lol. If you honestly believe that your opinion should mean more to me than all of those opinions just because "EVERYONE IS GOLD, MEEEEEEH!" Then you really need to get over yourself. 

I don't use the term "hater" too much, cuz I feel like it's an easy way to dismiss criticism, but you are legit just a hater lol. Try just being happy that someone accomplished something instead of being a salty little piss baby about it. 

XOXO
 {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
